definitions.definition: The actions or arguments of a sophist .
Plausible yet fallacious argumentations or reasoning.
An argument that seems plausible , but is fallacious or misleading , especially one devised deliberately to be so; a sophism .

main_definition: ( uncountable , historical ) The actions or arguments of a sophist .
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) Plausible yet fallacious argumentations or reasoning.
( countable ) An argument that seems plausible , but is fallacious or misleading , especially one devised deliberately to be so; a sophism .
